capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world just because you're a target for Lord Voldemort? It's incredible that he was able to overcome so much adversity and become one of the most iconic heroes in the fight against darkness.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's literally "The Boy Who Lived" - can you believe it? The fact that he survived that killing curse from Voldemort is just incredible. It's a testament to his bravery and the power of love. I mean, who else could have withstood such an evil force and come out on top?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Hagrid's possessions, and it seems like he has a pretty interesting collection. I mean, who wouldn't want to own a three-headed dog?
